Activity: Arrive at the office, check emails, and prioritize tasks for the week. Review the weekly goal: 'Develop and distribute initial communication materials (e.g., project overview, FAQs). Implement the communication plan, track communication effectiveness, and adjust as needed.'

Draft an email to @clinlead-1, @pchmp-1, @rn-1, @rn-2, @rn-3, @his-1, @his-2, @mrs-1, @mrs-2 to schedule a meeting to gather input on key project messaging and potential FAQs related to the EHR collection and influenza trend analysis. Topic: Project Communication Input Meeting.
Review existing project documentation and initial project plan for relevant information that can be used in the communication materials. Identify key stakeholders and their communication needs.
Work on drafting the project overview document. Include project goals, timelines, key stakeholders, and potential benefits of the EHR collection and influenza trend analysis. Save draft.
Continue drafting the project overview document, focusing on clear and concise language for all stakeholders.
Finalize the draft of the project overview document.

Draft initial set of FAQs addressing potential concerns about data privacy, workflow changes, and training opportunities. Review existing hospital policies related to data security and patient confidentiality.
Email @da-1, @da-2, @dba-1 to confirm that the data privacy and data security issues in FAQs are in accordance with current regulations. Topic: FAQ Review - Data Privacy and Security
Review draft communication materials (project overview and FAQs) to ensure accuracy, clarity, and consistency. Correct any mistakes.
Prepare for tomorrow's meeting with clinical and medical records staff. Compile questions and discussion points to ensure a productive session.
End of day. Leave the office.
